sub_title: International On Trade Key Account Manager at Bacardi
summary: Driven by diverse and challenging experience which has included working in both the US and Europe and recently switching from Finance to Commercial Sales.  I am a professional in the spirits industry with a passion for the great brands Bacardi produces and in my current position I am looking for opportunities to partner with great hotels and restaurants in a collaborative way.

profile_positions.title: International On Trade Key Account Manager

profile_positions.description:
	Influenced Regional strategy for 20 countries across 6 clusters through value creation insights and analysis provided to key business partners in the Clusters, Europe and Oceania Leadership Team and Global Finance.
	Partnered with Director of Insights and Strategy to build the Regional strategic vision for the next 5 years.
	Led scenario modeling for the Region based on trigger points to allocate resources and achieve profit targets.
	Led a working group that is driving a reporting breakthrough for Europe and Oceania region to drive business decisions based on profitability.
	Annually established and ensured full clarity of key performance drivers (KPIs) and assessment against the core Regional strategies. Recommended and presented appropriate actions needed to deliver commitments made.
profile_positions.title: Senior Manager of Financial Planning and Analysis

profile_positions.description:
•	Led a team of two Senior Analysts that provide analytics, insights, and recommendations for 65% of the US sales, leveraging internal and 3rd party data sources.
•	Liaised with Senior Leadership to influence and direct business decisions through modeling and scenario analysis for Annual Planning, Forecasting, and identification of Risks and Opportunities.    
•	Designed and implemented a best practice tool that is utilized by Bacardi and External Partners to review performance and make business decisions. 
•	Created vision and strategy for analysis and insights that were presented to BUSA and External Partners (QBR’s, Annual Planning, National Meetings).
•	Provided training and guidance on systems and processes to the Field Sales team in 27 markets.
•	Recognized with a Customer Impact Award for Analytic Tools created and provided to the Field Sales team.
•	Led the analysis and insight consolidation on a newly launched National Coupon program. These insights were presented to the Board of Directors.
profile_positions.title: Senior Commercial Analytics Manager

profile_positions.description:
•	Collaborated with the Regional Director of Advertising and Marketing to create Targeted Marketing campaigns for the Border Region, Gulf Coast Region, Central Market, Deli/Restaurants, Market, Bakery, and Test areas.  Central Texas Region was also covered for a team member on maternity leave. 
•	Partnered with the Director of Shopper Marketing and the Director of Strategy and Loyalty to create decks that were presented to the Senior Leadership Team that provided background on Targeted Marketing, key learning’s from competitive openings, and utilization of the customer data warehouse.
•	Created two new strategies for segmenting shoppers and providing offers as part of a Kroger and a Wal-Mart competitive blunting strategy.
•	Created the monthly budgeting process for the Targeted Marketing team and played a key role in compiling the information required to determine the FY 2015 budget for the Targeted Marketing team.
•	Considered the go-to team member by my manager for special projects and establishing new processes.
•	Indirectly managed one Project Manager I.  This includes providing tasks that need to be completed, guidance or clarification on any questions or issues, and training on processes or systems.
profile_positions.title: Targeted Marketing Project Manager II

profile_positions.description:
•	Created a monthly ad analysis report to provide insights and solutions to support HEB in running the most effective ad block for the category. The report compares the dollar sales, incremental dollars, price compared to competition, and share gain or loss for each ad block and package. The monthly reports are then compiled into a database of all ads reviewed to assess performance over time. This is the first ad analysis tool with this level of detail that had been provided by any brewer to the Buyer at HEB. 
•	Established my commitment to the customer by designing a tool that cuts down the time HEB spends on retail pricing by utilizing look-up tables to evaluate which items need to be priced versus those that can be eliminated. The tool on average saves HEB 4-8 hours per week.
•	Demonstrated bias for action by creating a “New Items at Risk Tracker” for the MillerCoors distributor network. The purpose of this tracker is to identify new items that are likely to be cut from the next round of sets because they are not hitting the profit threshold. This helps the overall category by increasing volume sales, dollar sales, and profit for these items by expanding consumer awareness through displays and sampling around the brands and packages at risk.
•	Led presentations at least twice a year for the MillerCoors distributor network which includes approximately 30 different distributors. These meetings cover priorities for the next round of sets, training on the HEB set process, and training on new tools.
profile_positions.title: Category Manager

profile_positions.description:
•	Recognized with 2011 Central Region Enabler of the Year Award and T3 2011 Central Region From Good to Great Award.

•	Cross-trained with multiple Area Sales Managers and the General Manager of the WTXNM management unit on execution at retail.  Areas that were evaluated include displays, share of beer cooler, trade-up flow sets, pricing, and merchandising.
•	Played an instrumental role in the WTXNM 2011 price increase by leading presentations for all WTXNM distributors that communicated our strategy prior to the price increase and assisted the General Manager with recommendations by price segment and package during the price increase process. 
•	Participated in a team that created a Pre and Post-Price Increase analysis tool that evaluated volume by segment, class of trade, brand, and package to ensure that the outcome was aligned with the planned strategy.
profile_positions.title: Business Analyst

•	Demonstrated bias for action by effectively completing 2 jobs roles (Sales Finance Analyst and Sale Accounting Analyst) for 3 months during a period of transition within the organization.
profile_positions.title: Sales Finance Analyst

profile_positions.description:

The account balances were either detail tested by selecting specific items within the balance and obtaining supporting documentation or by analytical procedures in which an expectation was developed and the expectation was compared to the actual balance for reasonableness.

profile_positions.title: Audit Senior

profile_positions.description:

This forum included representatives from China, Costa Rica, Japan, and England.

Researched US GAAP guidance to determine the appropriate technical accounting guidance related to the policy, reviewed Intel’s 10K to stress the importance of the policy in comparison to the Financial Statements.
profile_positions.title: Legal Entity Accountant
